==== Gimp ====
 <nowiki>[[http://www.gimp.org/downloads/|GIMP]]</nowiki> stands for “GNU image manipulation program”, and it is one of the oldest and most well known alternatives to Photoshop in existence. Although it doesn’t quite have all of them, you’ll find most of the features included in Photoshop somewhere in GIMP. GIMP is cross platform and supported by a large community.
<nowiki>[[http://tdmales.com/tomstech/files/2011/11/GimpColorPicker.png|{{http://tdmales.com/tomstech/files/2011/11/GimpColorPicker.png|Gimp|width=550</pre>]]</nowiki>

==== Krita ====
 <nowiki>[[http://www.koffice.org/krita|Krita]]</nowiki> has been lauded for ease of use and won the Akademy Award for Best Application in 2006. Part of the Koffice suite for Linux, Krita is slightly less powerful than both Photoshop and GIMP, but does contain some unique features.
<nowiki>[[http://www.koffice.org/krita|{{http://images.sixrevisions.com/2009/02/26-02_krita.png|Gimp|width=550</pre>]]</nowiki>

==== MyPaint ====
 <nowiki>[[http://mypaint.intilinux.com/|MyPaint]]</nowiki> is a fast and easy open-source graphics application for digital painters. It lets you focus on the art instead of the program. You work on your canvas with minimum distractions, bringing up the interface only when you need it.
<nowiki>[[http://mypaint.intilinux.com/|{{http://mypaint.intilinux.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/mypaint-2011-screenshots-concept_24.jpg</pre>]]</nowiki>

==== Inkscape ====
 <nowiki>[[http://inkscape.org/|Inkscape]]</nowiki> is an An Open Source vector graphics editor, it supports many advanced SVG features (markers, clones, alpha blending, etc.) and great care is taken in designing a streamlined interface. It is very easy to edit nodes, perform complex path operations, trace bitmaps and much more.
<nowiki>[[http://inkscape.org/|{{http://inkscape.org/screenshots/gallery/inkscape-0.48-ferrari.png|Inkscape|width=550}}]]</nowiki>

==== Blender ====
  <nowiki>[[http://www.blender.org/|Blender]]</nowiki> is a free and open-source 3D computer graphics software product used for creating animated films, visual effects, interactive 3D applications or video games.
<nowiki>[[http://www.blender.org/|{{http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1e/Blender254Screenshot.png/800px-Blender254Screenshot.png|blender|width=550}}]]</nowiki>
